newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak steel buys $11.5 mln plane - agency.
newsitem.headline: Slovak steel buys $11.5 mln plane - agency.

text.p: VSZ a.s., Slovakia's largest steel producer, has purchased a Hawker 800 XP jet plane for $11.5 million, the official Slovak news agency TASR said on Monday.
TASR said that according to leasing conditions, VSZ has already paid 25 percent of the plane's price, which in total amounts to one-quarter of its expected 1996 after-tax profit of $40.6 million.

VSZ said the new eight passenger plane, built by U.S-based Raytheon Aircraft Company, will be used by management for business trips abroad. The company also plans to hire the plane to other Slovak entrepreneurs for their travels.
VSZ currently owns the domestic Cassovia Air.
TASR quoted VSZ officials as saying the company is the first private firm in central and eastern Europe to own a jet airplane.
